Class EmployeeDB

java.lang.Object
EmployeeDB
public class EmployeeDB extends Object
Class used for handling database operations relating to employees and their information. Operations include: searching, updating, inserting, and returning employee information

  • Method Details

    • find_Employee

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Employee> find_Employee(String name) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Searches for employees whose names match or contain the given name string in the parameter
      Parameters:
      name - as the name or partial part of name for the employees being searched for
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of Employee objects that are returned from the query execution
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during the query execution
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found

    • searchEmployees

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Employee> searchEmployees() throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Retrieves all employees that exist in the database
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of all Employee objects that exist in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during the query execution
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found

    • updateEmployeeValues

      public static void updateEmployeeValues(int employee_ID, String employee_Email, Boolean status) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Updates the current email and active status of an employee in the database to new values
      Parameters:
      employee_ID - as the ID of the designated employee whose attributes are to be updated
      employee_Email - as the employee's new email attribute
      status - as the employee's new active status
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during the update operation
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found

    • insertEmployee

      public static void insertEmployee(int Employee_ID, String name, String email, String role, Date login, Boolean status) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Inserts a new employee into the database, given a set of appropriate attributes
      Parameters:
      Employee_ID - as the ID of the new employee
      name - as the new employee's name
      email - as the new employee's email
      role - as the new employee's role
      login - as the new employee's last login date
      status - as the new employee's current status
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during the insert operation
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found

    • find_edit_Employee

      public static Employee find_edit_Employee(String name) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Searches for a single employee by name and returns their information to be used for editing/updating later
      Parameters:
      name - as the employee's name to be searched
      Returns:
      the Employee object containing the inquired employee's information
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during the query execution
      ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver is not found
